name: Skewes's number
summary:
In number theory, Skewes's number is the smallest natural number 
  
    
      
        x
      
    
    {\displaystyle x}
  
 for which the prime-counting function 
  
    
      
        π
        (
        x
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle \pi (x)}
  
 exceeds the logarithmic integral function 
  
    
      
        li
        ⁡
        (
        x
        )
        .
      
    
    {\displaystyle \operatorname {li} (x).}
  
  It is named for the South African mathematician Stanl
